node.name: Yisu Zheng
node.about: New to the design world, wish to explore more possibilities of design! Also hit me up for the best photo spots on campus <3

node.name: Isabella Yuchang Zhou
node.about: I enjoy creation, especially the process of realizing one crazy idea. As both software engineer and designer I am actively involved in projects that develop cool products -- mobile apps, web apps, online game, etc. I have been a freelance illustrator since my entry to college and have recently collaborated with my favorite pop singer's concert team! I also design for Cornell Chinese Drama Society, Association of Computer Science Undergraduates, Cornell University Sustainable Design and some school magazines.

node.name: Ying Yang
node.about: I’m a sophomore majoring in ISST. As a part of DTI, I want to create new solutions that solve social issues for long-lasting impact. On-campus, I’m also a member of Cornell Cup Robotics, ACSU, and CSA. Outside of school, I love singing, exploring new music, searching for new fashion trends, and photography!

node.name: April Ye
node.about: When I'm not at Zeus or Starbucks, you can find me either meticulously brewing coffee or stir-frying the same noodle recipe for a year and counting. I love indulging in dating shows or haul videos while eating noodles, and have recently discovered a passion for making green smoothies!

node.name: Chelsea Wang
node.about: I love designing and I am also a huge fan of Fine Art Photography. My favorite photographers are Richard Rinaldi, Leslie Zhang, and Solomon Mortimer. I love old stuff, such as movies, photos, clothes, songs, because I feel a sense of connection to the past. I believe designing is a process of instilling empathy and expressing oneself.

node.name: Michelle Park
node.about:
Hello! My name is Michelle Park and I believe there is power in digital experiences that are designed for humans, by a human.
I was born in South Korea, spent my childhood in both Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City of Vietnam, and then grew up in Irvine, California. I believe that my experiences in growing up in different environments shaped me into the empathetic and fast-adapting person I am today. 
This past summer I ate lots of cake, explored new places by myself, sipped iced lattes, read books at a dog park, and went vintage store-hopping.

node.name: Aiden Yeonsuk Kim
node.about:
I'm a Product Designer currently studying Information Science at Cornell University. I became more involved in design after taking a course at Cornell called "Designing Technology for Social Impact."

I love solving problems, coming up with awesome solutions, then sometimes discovering I was wrong, and going back to the beginning to solve the issue from a new perspective. 

To me, design is like a game. A game which we can play with forever! A solution to a (design) problem will only be temporary, it will have to be solved again from a new point of view. Allowing us to play with it forever. I aim to learn from a diverse group of people, changers, influencers who love tackling challenges, share how to love others, and stay in bed with my dogs for as long as they allow me to.

node.name: Yuxuan Chen
node.about: Hi, I’m Yuxuan! I am a product designer who is passionate about making innovative social changes through design and building a bridge between people and possibilities. When I am not designing, I enjoy drawing, taking photos, listening to music, and petting cats & dogs.

node.name: Enoch (Chen)
node.about: I'm Enoch, a freshman that loves to learn! If you don't give me something to do, I'll do something anyways.

node.name: Yvonne Chan
node.about: I love working with people. DTI allows me to do this while also solving greater community problems. I also get to do what I love when I am nature walking, creative writing, and exploring new music with others. Apart from DTI, I am a member of the Assorted Aces Dance Team and the WICC Photo Committee. When I'm not working in Upson Hall, I'm finding the best study spots on campus or rediscovering my love for Brooklyn Nine-Nine!

node.name: Will Spencer
node.about: Hey! I'm Will, a sophomore developer on DTI, and I love to spend my time coding and helping out the community. Besides DTI, I am involved with Girls Who Code on campus, where I help high-school students learn and appreciate the basics of programming. Besides developing, I spend my time gaming and following politics, so I can commonly be found yelling at my computer due to a broken controller or some scandalous news story.

node.name: Vanessa Wang
node.about: Hi! I'm a junior studying computer science and minoring in electrical and computer engineering. Being on DTI has shown me how much of a positive impact I can make on the community using technology. Around campus, I devote my free time to volunteering with Alpha Phi Omega and helping out the Cornell Origami Club. You can also find me practicing my photography skills or crocheting away at home.

node.name: Vladia Trinh
node.about: Hi! I’m Vladia. I am an Operations Research major with a minor in Computer Science. On DTI, I hope to make a positive impact on Cornell and its surrounding community through engineering. Here, I am a member of Alpha Phi Omega, and tutor middle schoolers in Ithaca. I love to travel and explore new places almost as much as I enjoy staying home and making coffee. In my free time, you can catch me watching Grey’s Anatomy, getting Korean food in college town, or FaceTiming my dog.

node.name: Vivian Shiu
node.about: I'm ABC: American-Brazilian-Chinese and a designer. I'm passionate about the unaware effects design can have on a person's life. Outside of school you can find me drinking an açai smoothie or petting dogs around campus. I love to play soccer, piano, doodle, and nap!

node.name: Sam Zhou
node.about: I am a full stack web developer with extensive experience in backend development in Kotlin/Java/NodeJS and frontend development with React/Angular Framework. Sam is interested in designing and developing extensible and scalable software systems as well as programming languages.

node.name: Tony Yang
node.about: Hi! I'm Tony, a freshmen studying CS in the College of Arts and Sciences. I am interested in Android and web development. In my free time, I enjoy playing basketball, guitar, hiking, and photography.

node.name: Theresa Cho
node.about: Outside of school, I enjoy watching superhero movies (The Dark Knight is amazing - change my mind) Parks and Rec & the Office, and singing. I have joined Cornell Music VS on singing trips to Cayuga Ridge, a nursing home nearby, and have participated in the mass choir on Sunday nights. I am also a big sib in Cornell Catholic and a senior consultant for CS 1110: Intro to Python!

node.name: Chris Tae Seo Lee
node.about: I am a UX/Product/Visual Designer who's interested in building products that connect people and technology. After working as a UX Designer/Brand Designer/Product Manager at Asian Boss Inc. for a year, I'm now very excited to witness and corporate with Cornell communities to develop my insight and skillsets.

node.name: Shi Chong Zhao
node.about: Hi I am Shi Chong, a sophomore majoring in CS. I'm from Singapore where the season's always summer (opposite of Ithaca). Apart from being a member of DTI,  I am also a pipa player in the Cornell Eastern Music Ensemble. Hit me up!

node.name: Shane Yun
node.about: hi! I'm a product designer for CUE. I am comfortable with both mobile and iOS design. I am super excited to work on developing CUE!

node.name: Sophia Wang
node.about: Hi, I'm Sophia! I am currently a senior and the PM for Queue Me In. Outside of school I love hiking, painting, music festivals and Thai food. I am obsessed with my Cockapoo and even made him an Instagram. Feel free to contact me at sw847@cornell.edu if you want to chat!

node.name: Scott Wang
node.about: Hello! I'm a sophomore studying CS. While my interests are in ML/AI and software development (full-stack & mobile), I am personally fascinated in investigating the connections between technology, deep learning, and education. I enjoy developing video games, playing the cello, and playing Planetside 2 in my free time. My favorite food at Cornell is the Chicken Udon Stir Fry at Okenshields on Tuesdays.

node.name: Stacy Wei
node.about: Hi! I am currently a junior studying CS. On campus, I am Engineering Peer Advisor and involved with Assorted Aces Dance Team, SWE, and CSA. Outside of class, I am either jamming to music, exploring Ithaca, or learning how to cook.

node.name: Sanjana Seshadri
node.about: I'm an aspiring product designer and I hope to make a positive, social impact through the field of design. Besides designing, I love all things music and dance! On campus, I am a member of Cornell Anjali, an Indian classical dance team, and a member of Forté Campus at Cornell, a professional business organization. In my free time, I enjoy exploring new places to eat and drink coffee, finding fun things to take pictures of, and learning how to play my favorite songs on the piano.

node.name: Simran Puri
node.about: Outside of DTI, I continue to use my passion for creating socially impactful technology as part of Cornell Sustainable Design and Spark Design. My other interests include hiking, traveling, watching Grey's Anatomy, and drinking iced coffee.

node.name: Sam Steinberg
node.about: I’m a junior studying Information Science with a concentration in User Experience. I’m a maker at heart, and have always been fascinated with the intersection of design, technology, and business. When I’m not in Duffield doing homework, you can find me hanging out with friends at the gorges, watching sy-fy movies, performing stand-up comedy at open mics, and eating acai bowls at Chatty Cathy.

node.name: Roddy Taipe
node.about: I consider myself an aspiring web developer since I am still constantly learning about the web development, but I am also interested in other areas of CS including embedded systems and data science. I am currently working for Cosmoptera, a startup based in Ithaca trying to disrupt the precision viticulture market.

node.name: Rose Zhou
node.about: Hi! I'm a Computer Science sophomore minoring in Cognitive Science and Game Design. Aside from my work in DTI, I work on research that applies unsupervised learning to the development of common-sense reasoning in humans. I also volunteer at ACSU and Esports at Cornell's events. In every activity I do on campus, I love learning about other people and welcoming new students! My goals at Cornell are to learn more about the psychology of gaming and technology, to grow as a person, and to have fun! When I have time to burn, I'm playing video games, skiing, and making memes.

node.name: Rebecca Fu
node.about: I am currently a junior studying applied economics and management with a concentration in business analytics! DTI stood out to me because it gave me an opportunity to explore my interests in tech outside of class and meet a great community of people who were passionate about helping others. But outside of academics, I love to dance, play tennis, and browse the sales section at Urban. And you can probably catch me at eHub in the AMs dancing wildly to my throwback playlist.

node.name: Bobby Villaluz
node.about: Hey! I am a junior studying computer science. I'm passionate about cybersecurity and developing software for positive community impact. When I'm not in the stacks, I love to surf, read, hike and play ping pong.

node.name: Trey Burrell
node.about: Hey!  I'm Trey and when my software developer hat is off, I'm either an entrepreneur, music producer, or gamer.  I currently serve on the Executive Board for BET, LINK, and SWAG.  You can either catch me in the Engineering Quad doing work, the DPE Office greeting visitors, or the eHub working on one of my businesses.  Thanks for reading!

node.name: Peter Wu
node.about: I'm a freshman majoring in computer science, and I love building apps and websites that can help make a marked improvement on our daily lives. While I've spent a lot of my time developing web apps, I'm interested in a broad range of software and web technologies, especially as trends ebb and flow. You'll find me in Helen Newman Hall playing badminton on Tuesday, Thursday, or Saturday, or playing board and card games / getting bubble tea with friends.

node.name: Pinxuan Huang
node.about: Hello! I am an ardent creator who enjoys building nifty projects through different mediums such as digital art, video games, programming, and even food. Presently, I devote my time into being productive, whether it be learning new concepts, picking up a new skill, or collaborating with others. I love making things that have a positive impact on people.

node.name: Neha Rao
node.about: I love to stay busy on campus! Other than being a part of this amazing project team, I'm Co-President of Cornell's Original Musical Theatre Troupe, Anything Goes. In my free time, I enjoy singing, playing guitar, going to Zumba classes, watching Netflix, and eating ice cream!

node.name: Matt Zhao
node.about: I have the most fun when I'm doing something new, whether that be visiting foreign countries for the first time or taking on an interesting hobby. Alongside DTI, I'm currently on the executive board for Cornell Economics Society and a player for the Men's Club Volleyball team. On any day, you can probably find me procrastinating in eHub or Kung Fu Tea ( > U Tea).

node.name: Megan Yin
node.about: Hey! I'm Megan. I'm a CS student at Cornell with a minor in ORIE. I love creating user interfaces, analyzing data, and exploring the bleeding edge of web technologies. When I'm not working on stuff for DTI or trying to keep my GPA afloat, you can probably find me scrolling through relatable comics on Instagram, making memes, or just pondering the meaning of life (no the answer is not 42).

node.name: Michael Xing
node.about: Michael is a full stack developer who enjoys building things for people to use. He primarily works in Java and web technologies, but dabbles with anything and everything that looks remotely interesting. When not coding, he enjoys helping aspiring developers while TA'ing 2110 / 2112, playing the piano, or playing video games (not necessarily in that order).

node.name: Megan She
node.about: I'm a senior English major, but I identify as the ampersand in Arts & Sciences. I love working an espresso bar, making far too many Spotify playlists, and dabbling in the sublime. I'm also a member of Cornell Mars Rover and Science Olympiad at Cornell. I'm always looking for more niche academia, another stamp in my passport, and the best brie out there. And I'm always a sucker for bad jokes.

node.name: Matthew Guo
node.about: Hi! I'm Matthew, and I'm a sophomore CS major + Info Sci minor in the College of Arts and Sciences. I love to create, whether its through development, design, or even music.

node.name: Matthew Epstein
node.about: I am a Junior studying Computer Science and pursuing a minor in Business from the Dyson School of Business. I enjoy consumerism, YouTube, buying new electronics, and lists of three or more items. When I am not pretending to study or attempting to finish my homework, you can find me in my bed, at Cafe Jennie, or at Target. I am currently watching way too much food videos on YouTube, and I am searching for a new area of video entertainment to explore. If you see me on campus, please say hello! I love meeting new people (but need improvement on my name recall)!

node.name: Megan Chang
node.about: Hi! My name is Megan, and I'm a sophomore majoring in Information Science in the College of Arts and Sciences. I'm originally from southern California and when I'm not designing, you can find me taking photos, scrolling through TikTok, drinking way too much chai, or spending time outside.

node.name: Laura Sizemore
node.about: I am a junior studying Computer Science in the College of Engineering. I enjoy using technology to cause a positive impact in my community and beyond. In addition to technical project management, I have experience in full-stack development and data analysis. When I'm not coding, I enjoy reading sci-fi novels, playing board games, and spending time with friends.

node.name: Luis Rafael Hoderlein
node.about: I'm a Freshman in A&S studying Computer Science and Statistics. I'm fascinated by anything involving computers. When not programming, I like to read about space and history.

node.name: Lucy Wang
node.about: Hi! My name is Lucy and I am a sophomore studying Information Science. I am passionate about using technology to create social impact, and am excited to work on projects with so many cool people that all share the same interests! On campus I am involved with APO and ISSA, and you can always find me in Olin, probably with an iced coffee (rip my BRBs).

node.name: Katherine Tracy Go
node.about: Hi, I’m Katie! I’m a sophomore from Manila, Philippines studying Information Science. On campus I’m involved with Cornell Creatives, WICC, and Forté. I make YouTube videos every week on my channel, alohakatiex, and I love kimbap and fangirling over YA novels.

node.name: Kaushik Ravikumar
node.about: I'm an avid developer who loves seeing software used to solve problems. I'm also intrigued by the idea of Smart Cities and using the internet of things to improve our current infrastructures. I've previously worked at BuzzFeed and PubNub as a SWE. Besides that I love exploring nature, doing pretty much anything spontaneous, traveling, listening to music and dropping my own fire mixtapes on Souncloud.

node.name: Aram Chouldjian Baghdassarian
node.about: Gosh, I feel like these always come off as so generic and cliche and have always wondered what I can do to make them seem less trite. Do people even read these? I'm genuinely curious, so if you're reading this then click http://bit.ly/yes-i-actually-read-the-bio. When you open the link, you'll find instructions to see how many people also clicked the link!

node.name: Kinjal Jasani
node.about: I am a sophomore studying electrical and computer engineering with a minor in biomedical engineering. I love making technology that can create a positive impact! That's why over the summer, I created an iOS app called Motivation Monday. It's a social media app focused on positivity by showing each user posts that motivate them specifically, and allows users to post inspirational things! You can find it on the app store now! Besides academics, I love to play video games, watch Netflix, listen to pop music, and explore the best restaurants and attractions in Ithaca!

node.name: Nina Xie
node.about: Aspiring to solve real-world problems using technology, I’m growing to become a product driver. I’m passionate about interdisciplinary topics that combine tech, business, psych, and more. Besides a PM, I’m also a foodie, runner, music enthusiast, movie addict, and roller coaster lover.

node.name: Jessie Wong
node.about: I am a freshman studying Computer Science in the College of Engineering. I'm excited to explore creative ways to improve our community and beyond. On campus, I am an Alto 2 in Chorale, on the SWE grants committee, and a member of CTAS. When I'm not sleeping or napping, I'm probably learning about random things on Reddit, drinking vanilla lattes, making quality playlists, or binge-watching Rick and Morty. If you like blobfish, please talk to me.

node.name: Jason Tung
node.about: I'm a first year student in the college of engineering pursuing a degree in CS with a minor in math. While neglecting my schoolwork and extracurricular commitments, I listen to a lot, lot, lot of music, play video games, watch shows, and take naps. Beyond that, I also enjoy studying ethics and moral theory.

node.name: Jing Wen Soh
node.about: I am a freshman studying Applied Economics and Management, intending to concentrate in strategy and business analytics. Aside from DTI, I am also a member of the Cornell Undergraduate Asia Business Society and the Singapore Students’ Association. I’m interested in all things technology and sustainability, and how businesses and organisations can harness them to raise the triple bottom line. Catch me honing my foosball skills at Okenshields, playing badminton or watching Masterchef and food vlogs while eating ramen!

node.name: Julian Londono
node.about: Productivity is a lifestyle: when I'm not working with my team on CU Reviews you'll find me working on Info Sci research, exploring curiosity-driven side projects, mountain biking, or playing soccer or frisbee. I'm always trying to expand my technical knowledge and skill sets as well as explore more of the world whenever possible.  Fun fact: I took a road-trip from New Jersey to California and back this past summer and it was a blast!

node.name: Ji Eun Lee
node.about: Hey! My name is Joanne Lee. I am an ex-fashion designer, now a Product Designer. I've had some cool opportunities working with various stakeholders from all around the world- Costa Rica, Albania, and much more. When I design, EDM or House Music really helps me get in the zone. If you ever need me, you could probably find me in Olin first floor!

node.name: Jessica Chen
node.about: I love exploring/developing ways that technology can contribute to community impact. Aside from CDTI, I am also the philanthropy chair for Alpha Omega Epsilon (Cornell's engineering sorority), a member of the club tennis team, an AEW facilitator, and a Cornell Engineering Ambassador! In my free time, I enjoy hiking, hammocking, adventuring, eating, and chasing sunsets.

node.name: Jalil Evans
node.about: I love to help ideas grow from passing thoughts to real world products with actual impact. I'm a co-founder of a startup with the mission of improving the lives of POC on college campuses. I love to read books about business, design and self-development. I'm also an avid dancer - currently a member of Assorted Aces and BreakFree HipHop (come to our showcase!)

node.name: Jagger Brulato
node.about: I'm a junior majoring in Computer Science. I like writing and producing funk fusion music, and I do a lot of board/watersports. I also play a lot of chess and Tetris.

node.name: Jordan Epstein
node.about: I am a sophomore from New York City.  I'm a backend developer for DTI, but aside from that I like comedy movies, video games, and sports (Jets are having a rough year right now).  I regularly smack kids in Fifa, or 2K, and you can always find me late at night watching Family Guy.

node.name: Ishika Jain
node.about: I am currently a sophomore majoring in computer science and economics in the College of Arts and Sciences. In my free time, you can find me performing as part of Cornell’s Indian Classical Dance group, Cornell Nazaqat, cooking or watching one of the many TV shows on ABC. I am excited to explore the design and development side of applications. I am always Down to Integrate (DTI) design and development to create applications that help to add to the Big Red experience!

node.name: Han Wang
node.about: A fellow Canadian once said that "sometimes it's the journey that teaches you a lot about your destination". Being a part of DTI is about making a difference while learning how to do so. Outside of the project team, I fiddle around with MEAN stack development and entrepreneurship. If you ever need me, you can find me programming in a corner at your nearest hackathon.

node.name: Helen Yang
node.about: Hey, I'm Helen! I'm a freshman CS major hoping to learn about app+web dev and assistive technology. Outside of DTI, I'm also part of Science Olympiad, which I competed in while in high school. When I'm not crying about CS, you can find me playing Minesweeper and Tetris, binge-watching Bon Appetit videos, or jamming out to music ranging from classical to chiptune!

node.name: Hanwen (Hank) Lin
node.about: Hi! I am a product/UX designer for Eve, and currently a freshman majoring in Information Science with a concentration in UX Design. As a newbie to DTI and UX, I am striving to build a strong design portfolio, while learn from and serve the community with my teammates. Outside of academics, I enjoy playing the piano, composing, soccer, surfing, and traveling!

node.name: Gary
node.about: Hi! I am a junior studying cs and English. I lived in Canada and China before coming to the U.S. 80 of my diet consist of quesadillas and oolong tea.

node.name: Guanqun Wu
node.about: Hi I'm Guanqun and you can call me Guan. In my spare time, I like playing video games (Fire Emblem :D), eating food or taking photos of chipmunks (when they're out and about on campus). In my time at Cornell I've worked on a lot of random projects, like a pong game controlled by joysticks and a piano game with physical buttons.

node.name: Flora Liu
node.about: Hi, I'm Flora! I am currently studying Information Science in CAS, with concentrations in UI/UX and Digital Culture and Production. In my free time you can find me binging Tasty videos, drinking boba (30% sugar light ice ofc), or traveling (I've been to every single Disney in the world!).

node.name: Evan Welsh
node.about: I'm a junior in the College of Arts and Sciences majoring in Computer Science. In my free time I love exploring all sorts of wild technologies. My adventures in Vue.js in fact led to this very site to use it. I've worked within frontend web, backend, and mobile spheres and enjoy periodically switching things up to get a better sense of new and especially emerging platforms. Outside of DTI I enjoy singing in Cornell Chorale, studying Latin, and experimenting with gluten-free recipes among other things.

node.name: Ehi Esemuze
node.about: Hi! My name is Ehi and I’m a first-year studying mechanical engineering. My passion lies in using design across mediums to create sustainable, positive social impact. Outside of academic and project team work, you can find me acting in a show, attempting to pick up a new language, listening to music, or writing poetry or prose. Feel free to reach out to me and start a conversation!

node.name: Emily Reynolds
node.about: I am a junior double majoring in information science and computer science (because I just love to make my life more difficult..). You can find me in the library or around campus, but I'll probably accidentally ignore you because I like to blast my music in my earphones and stare into space. You will definitely not find me at a gym, sorry.

node.name: Erin Chen
node.about: I'm a senior in Arts & Sciences studying Information Science. I'm most passionate about the intersection of design, art, and storytelling. While design and technology has been my focus, I'm curious about the ways that good design can improve any field or industry. Talk to me about all sorts of design, cooking, plants, or music.

node.name: Ein Chang
node.about: Hi, I’m Ein! I’m a sophomore studying Computer Science and excited to be a part of a team where I can work with others from all different backgrounds to create an impactful product! On campus, I’m also involved in APO and SWE. I love going hiking and to concerts and am always down to eat tacos!!

node.name: Emily Chan
node.about: Hello! I'm Emily and I'm a product designer, nature lover, and meme enthusiast. When I'm not hanging out in Duffield or designing something with too many gradients, catch me rock climbing, hiking, cooking, playing guitar, or looking at cute otters on Instagram. I'm also passionate about using tech for social good! Here's a shameless plug for some of my favorite orgs I've worked with:  https://risefirst.org/, https://cariclub.com/, https://hack4impact.org/.

node.name: Elizabeth Mieczkowski
node.about: Hi, I’m Beth! I study CS and psychology in Arts & Sciences, and aside from DTI I’m a member of Big Red Thon, WICC, and Alpha Chi Omega on campus. In my free time, I enjoy reading, visiting art museums, and running. I love solving complex problems with creative solutions, especially when they have a social impact.

node.name: Chris Hansen
node.about: I am an ever-curious developer from New York who collects books and listens to punk rock music. Technology inspires me to help people, spurring my interests in cybersecurity and the web and giving me the courage to ask the questions that need asking.

node.name: Connie Lei
node.about: I am a sophomore majoring in computer science and minoring in psychology. I am a front-end developer on the Research Connect team. I love being able to understand where, why and how bugs happen. One of my passions is helping programs like GWC or KWK and having a hand in helping the next generation of girls in computer science!

node.name: Changyuan Lin
node.about: I am freshman freshman studying CS in Engineering. I really like riding bikes, as my picture probably suggests. When I'm not doing that I can be found in my room, or hopefully out socializing with other people. My other hobbies are photography and collecting fountain pens and listening to cool music. Oh yeah, I also enjoy coding things and messing around with computers. Probably why I'm here.

node.name: Dray Farley
node.about: I love working on software that solves real problems, whether it be on campus, in the fitness industry, or in social impact. I primarily work on back-end but love to explore new frameworks and tech stacks! Outside of tech, I am an RA on north campus and a huge (unfortunately) New York Knicks fan. I also enjoy reading and going to the gym in my free time.

node.name: Cedric Castillo
node.about: Hey, I'm Cedric and I'm a senior information science major. I joined DTI as a designer on cue, our events app, sophomore year. Fast forward to the end of junior year, I was given the privilege of joining the leads team to head our design initiatives. Over the past two summers, I've spent my time at a startup designing for growth at Concord, a contract success platform, and understanding how marketing teams utilize data visualizations as part of Facebook's connectivity branch. Outside of school and design, Cedric's currently working to hop on a new fashion wave and trying to learn more about coffee!

node.name: Bahar Tehranipoor
node.about: Hi! I'm a freshman majoring in computer science interested in digital humanities and using technology to make an impact internationally. I'm also the webmaster of my acapella group The Touchtones and if I can make the time, I tutor online making educational videos - think Khan Academy!

node.name: Bryan Graeser
node.about: When I'm not in Duffield working on a CS pset or DTI, I enjoy working on creative writing pieces and going to the gym. I am also Co-Director of Hack4Impact, a nonprofit, social impact CS group on campus. In my free time, I like playing games with friends and showing people unsolicited pet photos.

node.name: Bryant Lee
node.about: I am a developer excited to use my skills to make a positive impact on the community. I primarily do back-end development, with an emphasis on data science, but I do have familiarity with some front-end technologies if needed. Outside of DTI, I am a part of the data engineering subteam under Cornell Data Science, where we tackle difficult problems through data engineering techniques. I am also a Project Manager for Hack4Impact, a group where we develop software for social impact. Additionally, I am a course consultant for CS 2024, C++. In my free time, I enjoy playing games, hanging out with friends, and further developing a homebrew Gameboy game I made.

node.name: Bryan Tabor
node.about: I'm a freshman majoring in Computer Science. I'm interested in computer graphics and game development. In my free time, I like playing Tetris and rhythm games.

node.name: Brandon Hong
node.about: Hi! My name is Brandon Hong, and I am a sophomore in the Hotel School, also pursuing a minor in computer science. On campus, I am involved in Cornell Hotel Society, and I also work part-time in the Johnson payroll office. Outside of school, I enjoy following football (Go Niners!), cooking, watching Gordon Ramsay shows, and learning about the latest trends in technology!

node.name: Ben Shen
node.about: I am currently a sophomore undergraduate at Cornell studying Computer Science. I'm from New York City but I love nature just as much as city life. In my free time, I enjoy singing in The Glee Club and The Chordials! My favorite junk food is Cheetos and my favorite junk drink is iced tea.

node.name: Boon Palipatana
node.about: I'm an Information Science Major concentrating in Data Science. I love working with data analytics in addition to web, mobile app, and game development. Outside of class, I spend time watching basketball, running at a reasonable pace, being an RA in the Low Rises, and bonding with the squirrels on campus.

node.name: Aitong Yu
node.about: Hi, My name is Aitong Yu! I immigrated to the US when i was 9 and live in New York City since then. I hope to make positive impacts in the community and that's why I joined DTI. On campus, I am involved in ECaFT and Cornell Chinese Dram Society. During my free time, I like to watch figure skating competitions and collect postcards!

node.name: Ashrita Raman
node.about: Hi, I'm Ashrita! I am a junior majoring in computer science and minoring in music and linguistics. I am passionate about using technology to create a positive social impact. At Cornell, I teach piano to undergraduates through the Cornell Piano Society and am also a member of the Cornell Symphony Orchestra and Cornell Hack4Impact. Outside of class, you can find me listening to 19th century Romantic music, reading Harry Potter, going on a run, or taking pictures of good food.

node.name: Ashley Ticzon
node.about: When I’m not hiking up the slope to get to class, I enjoy singing and playing music. Also, I have a crazy good memory and can remember almost everything down to the smallest detail. And even though I grew up very accustomed to the warm California sunshine, I actually find the winters in Ithaca very enjoyable.

node.name: Adam Masters
node.about: I am a senior College Scholar with a double major in Information Science. My college scholar project is focused on assessing the ethical and social implications of advancing AI. I spent this past summer at Facebook as a Product Data Operations Specialist helping to price the overall product improvement of Facebook Portal. I also currently work for Assist, the leading chatbot provider for messaging and voice. On campus, I am a member of Suna Breakfast and Mundial FC. Outside of school I love photography and listening to music.

node.name: Andrew Gao
node.about: I'm a sophomore in the College of Arts & Sciences majoring in CS and Stats. I'm currently most experienced in Android and web/full-stack, but I'm always trying to explore and learn more. In my free time, I enjoy photography (hmu for headshots), graphic design, basketball, volleyball, and learning new things.

node.name: Ayesha
node.about: Hey! I am a CS major that loves the beach, calligraphy, and boba.  I'm into adventurous things that don't involve scratches or bugs. Also, catch me at Olin and Uris as a librarian to get to know me better.

node.name: Ansh Godha
node.about: I love playing squash in my free time. I also love Green Day. I hate writing.

node.name: Ashneel Das
node.about: I'm a second year student in the college of engineering studying computer science and math. I love to code, teach, and drink bubble tea! On campus I'm a member of Science Olympiad and DTI (of course). In my free time, I like to play cards, eat food, and watch Netflix.

node.name: Akash Aryal
node.about: Hi! My name is Akash Aryal. I am currently a freshmen at Cornell University majoring in CS in the college of Arts and Science. I'm currently interested in web and app development (both front and back end). I am most familiar with mysql and laravel but am looking to expand my stack to incorporate React and nosql dbms. In my free time I enjoy playing tennis, getting flamed in league, and lots of anime...lots.

node.name: Kathleen Xu
node.about: I'm a junior double majoring in Information Science and Applied Economics and Management. I'm happiest when I'm creating, whether that be writing a story, knitting a scarf or drawing. I'm currently a part of DTI (obviously), Shogi Club, and the Cornell Lunatic. When I'm not trying to power through all my work, you can find me drinking boba tea, watching anime, or obsessing over my betta fish.

hero.subheader: We are Cornell Design & Tech Initiative. But individually, we are a talented, diverse group of students from different colleges and countries striving to make a difference in our community.

diversity.description: More than just being inclusive, our team strives to bring as many backgrounds and perspectives together to solve community problems. These statistics come from recruiting across campus and seeking applicants with the best skills and potential for growth on the team. Updated Spring 2019.
